messages: ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:22): the makehuman .blend for blender didn't work out so well for me
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:22): can blender import makehuman's OBJ or BS files?
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (18:24): sheldonh: yeah blender support obj file
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (18:24): sheldonh: i import obj file from makehuman successful
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:25): and then putting clothes on characters
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:25): is that best done with bump maps?
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (18:25): sheldonh: i guess some of them do it by cutting the human body to different parts then make them to be clothes and textured
ee1b018cfa212b4286503b1d2bec6d66 (18:26): bump maps are quite oldschool, it's all normal maps now ;)
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (18:26): Phantom`: give some tutorials to see ?
ee1b018cfa212b4286503b1d2bec6d66 (18:27): sorry, on my irc-pc so can't browse for links :) (text based browsing isn't as fun as it sounds)
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (18:27): i think lighting and material is very important, but seldom see tutorials about that
ee1b018cfa212b4286503b1d2bec6d66 (18:29): it's an image that stores normal information (rgb <->  xyz), rather than height information(greyscale)
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (18:34): do you have an example ?
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:34): davidleon: what filter did you install to allow you to import OBJ files?
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:35): Phantom`: so you describe dark as low and light as high, and use a png texture where the darker lines in the jumpsuit are treated sa creases?
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:42): Phantom`: normal mapping looks more like a way to carry visual detail through for low-poly versions of more detailed models
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:42): Phantom`: i'm more asking how i get from a naked character to something that's clothed, hopefully without making clothes using CSG ;)
9fdc9734c424e80d09f928331fc44a72 (18:46): How I can bake textures (shadows) in Blender ?
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:47): so an RGB image used as a texture map wouldn't look like anything visually recognisable, since the channels encode normals
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:49): Phantom`: this is hectic stuff
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (18:52): example as in a bledner file + normal map pic or something similar
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:54): some technologies have The One True Book
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:54): does blender have such a thing, that's a nobrainer to buy?
be7acb0fdbe8360b94767339ede735f1 (18:55): no, there are no blender books
6974d1707d5aa64f5436b2016c20d801 (18:55): how can i spin an object with 90 degree?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (18:57): the key with a R writtent on
6974d1707d5aa64f5436b2016c20d801 (18:58): yes ;) allways suprising how easy blender is - if you know how to use it
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (18:58): all commands begins with the 1rst letter of the name
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (18:58): once you've selected that command, how do you control the degree to which it's applied?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (18:59): sheldonh, as i say before, numpadValue or mouse
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (19:00): lod how can i make a movie with a ball transform to a cube?
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (19:01): hmm.. normal mapping only alters the look of an object right ?
ca44b4ea67e785c0c83926fe1ddbc8e6 (19:03): LOD: and then click? enter? space?
a3d687f79ff6d2b86bfdfe8d014fcb16 (19:03): so its like bump mapping.. just adds details.. no physical changes of any kind ^^
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (19:03): LOD: woowo u did that tutorial really fast :p
984724c86e0fca843250d6eda9056728 (19:03): Enlighten me please. Before you apply a greyscale image as a displacement map you have to subdivide it first?
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:03): first or after, but you need before you render
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (19:04): LOD: if the case is much complicated what can i do? i mean totally different two object
984724c86e0fca843250d6eda9056728 (19:04): OK the tute in the release notes never actually say that
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:04): no problem, you only need to keep the same number of Vertex in all meshes
86f8d93a2789e31bb2a5243a9e821ad5 (19:05): LOD: is there some way of doing sculpture in blender?

4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:06): there is Dispaint.py, there is DispChanel, there is SculptTool in CVS
984724c86e0fca843250d6eda9056728 (19:06): use expresson or sculpt meseh python scrips

f8b4adabfa11a8fd5044c88b6dd7f5af (19:06): woo hoo again!! my spinning, PNG texture mapped cube
984724c86e0fca843250d6eda9056728 (19:06): or wait until sharpconstruct is integrated into the offical bf version of blender
4e034d79f6fd38d71ee4b49748485a3e (19:07): IMO Espresso was better that Sharpconstruct, but SharpC is not bad

984724c86e0fca843250d6eda9056728 (19:08): I would just like the author of Expresso to write a full tute.
